page.title: 10LOCAL FARMING SUMMARY.
page.content: THE MAJORITY OF THIS D BLOCK IS RURAL. AND SO THE MAIN INDUSTRY IS{FARMING. THERE ARE {18}FARMSTEADS IN THE AREA COVERED,AND MOST OF THESE ARE THESE ARE{MIXED FARMS}WITH SOME{DAIRY FARMS. {ANIMALS REARED ARE CHIEFLY,}DAIRY CATTLE, AND SHEEP. THE MAIN{CROPS}ARE CEREALS, WHEAT, BARLEY, OATS, POTATOES AND INCREASINGLY,OILSEED RAPE. BECAUSE MOST OF THE FARMS REAR ANIMALS,SOME OF THE LAND IS GIVEN OVER TO THE GROWING OF GRASS FOR{FODDER CROPS}SUCH AS SILAGE AND HAY. OUR LAND COVER SURVEY SHOWED THAT THE FARMS IN THE NORTH OF THE BLOCK ARE TYPICAL SMALL MIXED FARMS, WHICH HAVE CHANGED LITTLE, BUT THE FARMS IN THE SOUTH EAST OF THE BLOCK HAVE BEEN JOINED TOGETHER, HEDGES HAVE BEEN TAKEN OUT TO MAKE THE FIELDS LARGER. THESE HAVE THEN BEEN PLANTED WITH THE 3 MAIN{CEREALS. { }
